BCB330Y1-Y-20235.courseTitle: Special Project in Bioinformatics and Computational Biology
BCB330Y1-Y-20235.courseDescription: An opportunity for specialized individual research in bioinformatics and computational biology by arrangement with a supervisor. Approval of the application by the BCB coordinator is required. Not eligible for CR/NCR option.
BCB330Y1-Y-20235.prerequisite: Permission of the course coordinator (application required). Significant background in both life science and computer science courses is required.
BCB330Y1-Y-20235.webTimetableInstructions: Students are responsible for finding their own supervisor. For more information, please go to: https://bcb.csb.utoronto.ca/bcb330y-project. Once a supervisor is confirmed, please submit a completed BCB330Y contract to undergrad.csb@utoronto.ca by Thursday, April 27. Contract forms are available online: https://csb.utoronto.ca/undergraduate-studies/resources/forms/.
BCB330Y1-Y-20235.deliveryInstructions: The delivery of independent research courses is unique to each project. The project is typically designed by the supervisor with input from the student. Students are responsible for contacting possible supervisors. Students will work primarily on their own, but are required to meet with their supervisors at mutually convenient times throughout the term.

BCB430Y1-Y-20235.courseTitle: Advanced Special Project in Bioinformatics and Computational Biology
BCB430Y1-Y-20235.courseDescription: An opportunity for advanced specialized individual research in bioinformatics and computational biology by arrangement with a supervisor. Approval of the application by the BCB coordinator is required. BCB330Y1 is a recommended preparation for this course however students should not normally conduct their project in the same laboratory or continue their previous project. Not eligible for CR/NCR option.
BCB430Y1-Y-20235.prerequisite: Permission of the course coordinator (application required). Significant background in both life science and computer science courses is required.
BCB430Y1-Y-20235.webTimetableInstructions: Students are responsible for finding their own supervisor. For more information, please go to: https://bcb.csb.utoronto.ca/bcb430y-project. Once a supervisor is confirmed, please submit a completed BCB430Y contract to undergrad.csb@utoronto.ca by Thursday, April 27. Contract forms are available online: https://csb.utoronto.ca/undergraduate-studies/resources/forms/.
BCB430Y1-Y-20235.deliveryInstructions: The delivery of independent research courses is unique to each project. The project is typically designed by the supervisor with input from the student. Students are responsible for contacting possible supervisors. Students will work primarily on their own, but are required to meet with their supervisors at mutually convenient times throughout the term.
